final_answer:
The humor in this image arises from the juxtaposition of how photos are displayed on different devices. On the left, a phone shows a full landscape photo, fitting perfectly on the smaller screen. On the right, a computer displays the same photo, but it's awkwardly cropped, only occupying a narrow portion of the larger screen.

The text "YES, BUT" adds to the satire, highlighting the irony that while a phone can show the entire photo nicely, a larger screen designed for better viewing experience fails to do so properly. This playfully critiques how technology doesn't always work as expected or how bigger isn't always better.
ground_truth: This image is funny, as when using the "photos" app on mobile, it shows you images perfectly, which fill the entire screen, but when viewing the same photos on the computer monitor, the same images have a very limited coverage of the screen.
